intro: Obione spinibractea, commonly known as the spiny-bracted obione, is a rare and delicate flowering plant native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the family Poaceae, commonly known as the grass family, and is characterized by its slender, grass-like stems and narrow, linear leaves. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically clustered in dense inflorescences. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and conservation studies.
